body.p:
Philadelphia 702 Walnut St
July 31, 1865
His Excellency
Thomas E. Bramlette
Governor of Kentucky
Sir,
After over four years absence in the volunteer service of the United States, I have returned to resume my practice at the Philadelphia bar --
I would most respectfully call your attention to the recommendations hereon endorsed, and ask of you the appointment of Commissioner of Deeds &c for your State.
Should this application receive your favorable consideration, I will at once remit the necessary fees, upon receipt of a mem. of the amount from your Secretary --

I have the honor to be
Your obt. servant
Charles H. T. Collis
late Bvt. Major Genl. Vols

Collis, Charles H. T.
Atty at Law
(late Bvt. Maj. Genl. Vols)
Ask appointment of Commissioner of Deeds &c to be resident at Philadelphia
Charles H. T. Collis, Esqr has been a member of the Philadelphia bar for, several years, in good standing.
We cordially recommend him as being well qualified to perform the duties of Commissioner of Deeds &c

Judges of the Sup. Ct.
James Thompson
John M. Read
W. Stronge
